definition:
A solenoidal vector field is one that satisfies
$${\nabla}\cdot{\mathbf{B}}= 0$$ at every point where the vector field
${\mathbf{B}}$ is defined. Here ${\nabla}\cdot{\mathbf{B}}$ is the
divergence.

This condition actually implies that there exists a vector
${\mathbf{A}}$, such that $${\mathbf{B}}= {\nabla}\times{\mathbf{A}}.$$

For a function $f$ satisfying Laplace’s equation $${\nabla}^2f = 0,$$ it
follows that ${\nabla}f$ is solenoidal.
